entities.name: Face+Emotion Thumbnail
entities.description: Close-up face with strong emotion (shock, excitement) + 1-3 words increases CTR 20-30%

entities.name: Hook-First Script
entities.description: First 10 seconds must hook; retention drops 20% if intro is weak

entities.name: 8+ Minute Videos
entities.description: Videos 8+ minutes enable mid-roll ads, increasing CPM 40-60%

memories.content: YouTube Algorithm 2025 Core Principle: Algorithm judges CHANNELS not individual videos. Pattern consistency matters more than viral spikes. Build channel identity, not one-hit wonders.

YouTube Algorithm Key Metrics (2025): 1) Click-through rate (CTR) - aim for 4-10%, 2) Watch time & retention - aim for 50-70%, 3) Engagement - likes, comments, shares in first 24h, 4) Session time - do viewers watch more YouTube after your video?
Retention Benchmarks: 50-60% retention = solid. 70%+ retention = priority in suggested videos. First 10 seconds are critical - this is where most drop-off happens. Hook immediately or lose viewers.

YouTube Monetization Requirements 2025: Standard YPP requires 1,000 subscribers AND either 4,000 public watch hours in 12 months OR 10 million Shorts views in 90 days. Must comply with all monetization policies.
CPM by Niche (2025 averages): Finance $10-30, Technology $5-15, Education $5-12, Health/Fitness $3-10, Gaming $1-5. Average overall CPM ~$3.50. Tech/AI tutorials are high-CPM sweet spot.
RPM Reality Check: If CPM is $10, RPM (what you actually earn) is ~$5.50 after YouTube's 45% cut. Shorts RPM is brutal: $0.01-$0.06 per 1000 views. Long-form is where the money is.
Q4 CPM Boost: October-December CPMs increase 60-120% due to holiday advertising budgets. Plan your best content for Q4. Worst time to start a channel: January (CPM crash).
Thumbnail Formula That Works: Face with strong emotion (shock/excitement/curiosity) + 1-3 bold words + high contrast colors (yellow, orange stand out). VidIQ data shows this increases CTR 20-30%.

MrBeast Thumbnail Insight: It's HOW you show your face, not WHETHER you show it. Closed-mouth expressions tested better than open-mouth. Extreme expressions + simplified text (1-2 words) + dramatic color contrast.

Thumbnail Mobile-First Rule: Most YouTube views are mobile. Keep text minimal (3 words max), make it readable at tiny sizes. One focal point, clean design. Test with YouTube's Test & Compare feature (up to 3 thumbnails).

Title Formula: First 45-50 characters visible on mobile (truncation point). Structure: Keyword-rich first half | Engaging hook. Power words: Secret, Hidden, Shocking (curiosity), Now, Fast (urgency), Expert, Best, Proven (authority).

Ethical Clickbait Rule: Only promise what video delivers. Misleading titles kill retention, which kills recommendations. Phrasing as questions works: 'Can I do X?' instead of 'I did X!' if outcome uncertain.

Copyright Strike vs Claim: Content ID CLAIMS are automated, don't hurt channel, just affect monetization. COPYRIGHT STRIKES are manual, legal, serious. 3 strikes in 90 days = channel termination + ban from creating new channels.

Copyright Avoidance: Use licensed/royalty-free content ONLY. Fair use is legally complex - don't rely on it without lawyer advice. Even private/unlisted videos get scanned by Content ID. 2025 update: AI commentary without transformation = policy violation.

Copyright Strike Recovery: Strikes expire in 90 days IF you complete Copyright School AND have fewer than 3 strikes. Can also get retraction from rights holder or submit counter-notification if legitimate fair use.

Sponsor Requirements (2025): YouTube BrandConnect requires 25K+ subscribers, no community strikes, YPP membership, policy compliance. But you can get sponsors directly with smaller audiences if niche-relevant and high engagement.

Sponsor Value Insight: Niche authority beats raw views. A 50K-view fitness creator can charge more than 200K-view general vlogger because audience-brand alignment drives conversions. Engagement rate matters more than subscriber count.

Sponsor Deal Models: 1) Flat rate - fixed fee per video ($hundreds to $thousands based on reach), 2) Commission/affiliate - 10-20% of sales via tracking link, 3) Hybrid - base fee + performance bonus. Commission aligns incentives.

FTC Sponsor Disclosure Rules: Verbal disclosure in first 30 seconds. Written disclaimer in description: 'Sponsored by [Brand]' - not vague language. Use YouTube's 'Paid Promotion' checkbox. Non-compliance = legal risk.

YouTube Dynamic Sponsorship Slots (2025): New feature allows inserting sponsor content for set time period, then re-selling slot to new sponsor. Maximizes earning potential of evergreen videos. Game-changer for long-term monetization.

AI Tools Stack for YouTube (2025): Scripting: ChatGPT Plus ($20/mo). Thumbnails: Canva Pro ($13/mo) or Midjourney. Editing: Descript ($24/mo) or CapCut (free). Voice: ElevenLabs (free tier 10K chars). 83% of creators now use AI in workflow.

AI Content Warning (2025): YouTube updated policies July 2025 - 'inauthentic content' including AI commentary, reaction clips, compilations without clear transformation/editing/value-add impacts revenue sharing. AI must ASSIST, not REPLACE creator value.

Tech/AI Niche Opportunity: AI tutorials exploding because 75% of business leaders now use generative AI but need guidance. Monetization paths: Affiliate marketing ($500-2000/mo), Sponsored reviews ($1500-3000 each), Courses ($50-200/student).

Low Competition Tech Niches: Digital minimalism, niche software tutorials (one specific tool deep-dives), budget tech reviews. Key: Pick ONE tool and go deep. Canva AI tips, CapCut tricks, ChatGPT automation. Clarity beats breadth.

Shorts Strategy: Use Shorts for DISCOVERY, long-form for ENGAGEMENT and MONETIZATION. Shorts RPM is $0.01-0.06 (terrible). But Shorts can funnel viewers to long-form. 30-second Short with 85% retention beats 60-second with 50%.

Hook Structure That Works: Pattern interrupt in first 3 seconds (visual or audio surprise), then promise/preview of value, then loop open (create curiosity gap). Never start with 'Hey guys' - instant retention killer.

Script Structure for Tutorials: 1) Hook with outcome/transformation (10 sec), 2) Credibility/why listen to you (10 sec), 3) Overview of what you'll cover (20 sec), 4) Content with clear chapters, 5) CTA + next video tease. Match expectations set by title/thumbnail.

Packaging Principle: Many creators spend hours filming/editing but minutes on titles/thumbnails. This is BACKWARDS. Packaging determines if people click. Best content means nothing if CTR is low. Spend 30%+ of effort on packaging.

Algorithm Personalization (2025): Recommendations shaped by viewer's long-term watch history, session habits, and interaction patterns over time. Your job: Make content so good that viewers watch multiple videos per session (session time is key metric).

Subscriber Loyalty > Viral Spikes: Viral videos create spikes but not fans. Loyal subscribers drive consistent views, better engagement, sponsor appeal. Build relationship through series, community posts, consistent upload schedule.
A/B Testing Tools: TubeBuddy for title A/B testing (7 days, compare CTR/watch time). YouTube native Test & Compare for thumbnails (up to 3 variants). Data beats intuition. Test everything.

Geographic Targeting for CPM: Tier 1 countries (US, UK, Canada, Australia) pay premium ad rates. If making English content, optimize for these markets. Posting time: 2-4pm EST hits US prime time + catches UK evening.
